News

  • 27.01.16 - The issue of characterising mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks has been solved through collaboration with Collège de France in Chemistry: A Europen Journal this week.
  • 21.01.16 - Jarvist’s work on polar domains in CH3NH3PbI3 has been named as the most accessed APL Materials article in 2015.
  • 14.01.16 - A collaboration with UCL has explored the potential photovoltaic materials BiSI and BiSeI in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 08.01.16 - Keith spent last summer at Tokyo Institute of Technology, which has resulted in a new method and paper on screening solar cell interfaces in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 06.01.16 - Lee finalised a study into the layered dichalcogenide SnS2 with Liverpool and Bristol in Journal of Materials Chemistry.
  • 05.01.16 - Jess shows how the pore geometry of metal-organic frameworks can be controlled by composotion with the Burrows group in a special issue of Dalton Transactions.
  • 04.01.16 - A new study of Raman scattering in ZnS/ZnSe alloys in collaboration with IREC is published in PCCP.
  • 03.01.16 - A collaboration with the Cheetham group on the chemical bonding of ferroelectric formate perovskite frameworks appears in Chemistry of Materials.
  • 02.01.16 - Adam reports a new chemical potential to describe sulfur vapours in Chemical Science.
  • 01.01.16 - A collaboration with KCL and ICL on the optical properties of CH3NH3PbI3 is published in Nanoscale.
  • 21.12.15 - The new website goes live. Goodbye iWeb, hello Jekyll.
